title: MBUK July 2021 issue on sale now. Subscribe and get a pair of G-Form Pro-X3 knee pads!
content:
MBUK’s July issue is in the shops now – with a free 84-page Trail Guide containing details of 114 top UK riding spots!

This issue is all about good times and going fast – both things cover star Wyn Masters is known for. Find out how the Kiwi racer gets serious results without ever taking things too seriously, and get a masterclass in the ‘lanual’.

On test, there are four World Cup-ready downhill bikes and 12 pairs of flat-pedal shoes, along with some clipless XC options. The team reveal their favourite Scottish blue trail, try their hands at a retro bike build, show how to calculate chain length and get race-prep tips from the Athertons’ coach. All this plus rides at Exeter Bike Park and the Wye Valley. Don’t miss it!

  • Subscribe to Mountain Biking UK to receive your free gift as well as discounts and more

In it to Wyn it

Wyn Masters is a mountain biker’s mountain biker: his racing gets serious results without ever losing the fun factor. This adventurous Kiwi is now based in southern England, and MBUK heads over to his neck of the woods to spend a day in the life of one of the scene’s brightest stars.

Speed demons

The ultimate ‘one-trick-pony’, the downhill bike is built to descend – and descend fast. They might lack the versatility of modern trail bikes, but they’ve got it where it counts. In this month’s biketest MBUK is putting four of the very best DH machines money can buy through their paces, to see which World Cup-worthy warrior would end up on the podium.

Flat-pedal shoes on test

To complement the ‘foot out, flat-out’ style of downhill racers, the grouptest this issue focuses on flat-pedal shoes. The team have taken 12 the greatest and grippiest flats on the market and tested them head-to-head, to find your sole mate – the pair that will serve you best both on and off the bike.

Reviving the Rockhopper

MBUK’s art editor Jimmer takes a trip down memory lane and, with all the will in the world but little of the knowhow to back it up, attempts the holy grail of retro bike builds – a 1993 Specialized Rockhopper. The story of his project should stand testament to the old adage that if you’ve got the motivation, the rest will follow.

Blues cruise

In the third and final part of our series to find and ride the UK’s best blue-graded trails, MBUK is heading north of the wall to the MTB mecca of Scotland. With such a wealth of brilliant blues over its awe-inspiring mountains and glens, will their pick scotch the competition?

And that’s not all…

This issue of MBUK is jam-packed with all the latest and greatest bikes, product reviews and news stories from the mountain biking world. There are new bikes from Scott, Santa Cruz and Cannondale, along with pages of product reviews that include Pembree’s R1V flat pedals.
